sn55.28:4.2: Seated to one side, the Buddha said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:
sn55.28:4.3: “Householder, when a noble disciple has quelled five dangers and threats, has the four factors of stream-entry, and has clearly seen and penetrated the noble process with wisdom, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
sn55.28:4.4: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’
sn55.28:5.1: What are the five dangers and threats they have quelled?
sn55.28:5.2: Anyone who kills living creatures creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. That danger and threat is quelled for anyone who avoids killing living creatures.
sn55.28:5.3: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who avoids killing living creatures.
sn55.28:5.7: Anyone who uses alcohol and drugs that cause negligence creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. That danger and threat is quelled for anyone who avoids using alcohol and drugs that cause negligence.
sn55.28:5.8: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who avoids using alcohol and drugs that cause negligence.
sn55.28:5.9: These are the five dangers and threats they have quelled.
sn55.28:6.1: What are the four factors of stream-entry that they have?
sn55.28:6.2: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.28:6.7: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones …
sn55.28:6.9: These are the four factors of stream-entry that they have.
sn55.28:7.1: And what is the noble process that they have clearly seen and penetrated  with wisdom?
sn55.28:7.2: A noble disciple rationally focuses on dependent origination itself:
sn55.28:7.3: When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
sn55.28:7.4: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
sn55.28:7.5: Ignorance is a condition for choices. Choices are a condition for consciousness. Consciousness is a condition for name and form. Name and form is a condition for the six sense fields. The six sense fields are conditions for contact. Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving. Craving is a condition for grasping. Grasping is a condition for future existence. Future existence is a condition for rebirth. Rebirth is a condition that gives rise to old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn55.28:7.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn55.28:7.7: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease. When choices cease, consciousness ceases. When consciousness ceases, name and form cease. When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases. When contact ceases, feeling ceases. When feeling ceases, craving ceases. When craving ceases, grasping ceases. When grasping ceases, future existence ceases. When future existence ceases, rebirth ceases. When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn55.28:7.8: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn55.28:7.9: This is the noble process that they have clearly seen and penetrated with wisdom.
sn55.28:8.1: When a noble disciple has quelled five dangers and threats, has the four factors of stream-entry, and has clearly seen and penetrated the noble process with wisdom, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
sn55.28:8.3: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’”
